items.title: Quick Hack: Monitoring Plex Streams with Python/Flask and Tautulli API
items.content_html: This evening, I dived into a fun and practical project: leveraging the Python/Flask framework in combination with the Tautulli API. The goal? To create a seamless way to view current streams from multiple Plex servers.
items.content_text: This evening, I dived into a fun and practical project: leveraging the `Python/Flask` framework in combination with the `Tautulli API`. The goal? To create a seamless way to view current streams from multiple `Plex servers`.

items.title: How to Make DUNDERGL√ñGG (Mulled Wine): A Swedish Recipe
items.content_html:
It’s time to brew some DUNDERGL√ñGG, also known as Mulled Wine.

I’ve done this several times before, and it’s difficult to fail. You can experiment as you like, but for your first attempt, I recommend following the original recipe. After the initial try, I suggest adding some fresh sliced oranges with the peel still on.

This year, I’m experimenting with “apple must” (apple juice-ish) instead of svagdricka (a type of Swedish malt beverage). If svagdricka is hard to find outside Sweden, you can substitute it with non-alcoholic beer.

Original Recipe:

  • 5 liters of svagdricka (a type of Swedish malt beverage)
  • 5 sliced raw potatoes
  • 1 packet of baker’s yeast, 50 g
  • 1 bag of cloves
  • 1 bag of cardamom seeds
  • 1 piece of fresh ginger (about 5 cm)
  • 1 cinnamon stick
  • 500 g raisins
  • 2.5 kilograms of sugar

Mix everything in a ten-liter bucket, cover it with plastic wrap with small holes in it, and let the brew sit at room temperature for at least three weeks, preferably six. Bottle it into well-cleaned bottles using a siphon, being careful not to include the sediment at the bottom. Heat and enjoy.

Good to know:

  • Spices: The measurement of spices is not entirely precise, as you may have noticed. Season to your taste ‚Äì those who love cinnamon can add an extra stick.

  • Alcohol content: The alcohol content of the mulled wine typically ranges between 10 and 15 percent.

  • Storage: The mulled wine can be stored for one or two years after bottling, and it should only get better in taste. Eventually, it will oxidize, and you’ll notice it.

  • Yeast: I personally recommend using wine yeast. But you can use regular bread yeast, which seems to work excellently. You can try at your own risk with sweet bread yeast or another type. For safety, dissolve the yeast in a little svagdricka separately first.

  • Svagdricka: Svagdricka may start appearing on store shelves around this time of year, but sometimes it doesn’t arrive until November. Keep pestering your grocer and remember that svagdricka is sometimes called “Juldricka” (Christmas drink).
items.content_text: It's time to brew some **DUNDERGL√ñGG**, also known as Mulled Wine. I've done this several times before, and it's difficult to fail. You can experiment as you like, but for your first attempt, I recommend following the original recipe. After the initial try, I suggest adding some fresh sliced oranges with the peel still on. This year, I'm experimenting with "apple must" (apple juice-ish) instead of **svagdricka** (a type of Swedish malt beverage). If svagdricka is hard to find outside Sweden, you can substitute it with non-alcoholic beer. ## Original Recipe: - 5 liters of **svagdricka** (a type of Swedish malt beverage) - 5 sliced raw potatoes - 1 packet of baker's yeast, 50 g - 1 bag of cloves - 1 bag of cardamom seeds - 1 piece of fresh ginger (about 5 cm) - 1 cinnamon stick - 500 g raisins - 2.5 kilograms of sugar Mix everything in a ten-liter bucket, cover it with plastic wrap with small holes in it, and let the brew sit at room temperature for at least three weeks, preferably six. Bottle it into well-cleaned bottles using a siphon, being careful not to include the sediment at the bottom. Heat and enjoy. ## Good to know: - **Spices**: The measurement of spices is not entirely precise, as you may have noticed. Season to your taste ‚Äì those who love cinnamon can add an extra stick. - **Alcohol content**: The alcohol content of the mulled wine typically ranges between 10 and 15 percent. - **Storage**: The mulled wine can be stored for one or two years after bottling, and it should only get better in taste. Eventually, it will oxidize, and you'll notice it. - **Yeast**: I personally recommend using wine yeast. But you can use regular bread yeast, which seems to work excellently. You can try at your own risk with sweet bread yeast or another type. For safety, dissolve the yeast in a little **svagdricka** separately first. - **Svagdricka**: **Svagdricka** may start appearing on store shelves around this time of year, but sometimes it doesn't arrive until November. Keep pestering your grocer and remember that **svagdricka** is sometimes called "Juldricka" (Christmas drink).

items.title: Digital dieting
items.content_html:
I am currently undergoing a digital diet or cleanse.

I deleted my Reddit account which I’ve used for more than 11 years. The reason was the recent API changes, but I felt it was time to switch from unproductive time to productive time.

Even my biggest Achilles' heel, IRC, almost succumbed today. However, I didn’t quit completely; I just changed my self-hosted web client, The Lounge, for irssi instead. This is because I’ve decided not to use IRC on my phone anymore, only from my PC.

I will write more about this journey in the next couple of days, highlighting some interesting findings.
items.content_text:
I am currently undergoing a digital diet or cleanse.

I deleted my Reddit account which I've used for more than 11 years. The reason was the recent API changes, but I felt it was time to switch from unproductive time to productive time.

Even my biggest Achilles' heel, [IRC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Relay_Chat), almost succumbed today. However, I didn't quit completely; I just changed my self-hosted web client, [The Lounge](https://thelounge.chat/), for [irssi](https://irssi.org/) instead. This is because I've decided not to use IRC on my phone anymore, only from my PC.

I will write more about this journey in the next couple of days, highlighting some interesting findings.

items.content_html:
I’m like two years into Linux… but some stuff never get stuck to my brain. Every time I do “sudo apt install ” and I get this error “Errors were encountered while processing:”

This always fix it:

sudo apt-get -f install
items.content_text:
I'm like two years into Linux... but some stuff never get stuck to my brain.
Every time I do "sudo apt install <something>" and I get this error "Errors were encountered while processing:"

This always fix it:

    sudo apt-get -f install

items.content_html:
Everytime I try to add my Ledger to a new computer it always has connection issues

Ledger has come up with an easy fix

Just run this in a terminal

wget -q -O - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LedgerHQ/udev-rules/master/add_udev_rules.sh | sudo bash
items.content_text:
## Everytime I try to add my Ledger to a new computer it always has connection issues

Ledger has come up with an easy [fix](https://support.ledger.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005165269-Fix-connection-issues)

Just run this in a terminal

    wget -q -O - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LedgerHQ/udev-rules/master/add_udev_rules.sh | sudo bash

items.content_html:
Can’t runt app images out of the box with Linux Mint or Ubuntu.

The problem here is that Ubuntu is missing the FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace) library. This FUSE library provides an interface for userspace programs to export a virtual filesystem to the Linux kernel.

Open terminal and type

sudo apt install libfuse2

Then run the app image.
items.content_text:
## Can't runt app images out of the box with Linux Mint or Ubuntu.

> The problem here is that Ubuntu is missing the FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace) library. This FUSE library provides an interface for userspace programs to export a virtual filesystem to the Linux kernel.

Open terminal and type 

    sudo apt install libfuse2

Then run the app image.

items.content_html:
Ofcourse I want my app images in Linux application launcher

How to install:

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:appimagelauncher-team/stable

sudo apt-get update

sudo apt-get install appimagelauncher
items.content_text:
## Ofcourse I want my app images in Linux application launcher

**How to install**:

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:appimagelauncher-team/stable

sudo apt-get update

sudo apt-get install appimagelauncher

items.content_text:
Ser att m√•nga fr√•gat mig hur jag reggat konto p√• Threads redan trots att det inte √§r lanserat i Sverige √§n.

F√∂r att kunna installera appen beh√∂ver du en Android-telefon. Det finns s√§kert knep f√∂r iPhone ocks√•, men tyv√§rr f√•r du googla upp den informationen sj√§lv :)

P√• din Android-lur s√• surfar du in p√• apkmirror.com och s√∂ker upp "Threads, an Instagram app".

Troligtvis kan du ladda ned versionen som listas f√∂rst, d√§r det st√•r "armeabi-v7a" under "Architecture".

Skulle det mot f√∂rmodan inte fungera att installera denna version s√• kan du bara ta n√§sta i listan. Alternativt letar du upp vad din telefon k√∂r genom att tanka hem "Droid Hardware Info" och tittar sedan under "System". Exempel min telefon k√∂r "ARMv8-A". Se bild

Tryck p√• pilen ute till h√∂ger f√∂r att komma till nedladdningssidan [Threads, an Instagram app 289.0.0.77.109 (arm-v7a) (Android 7.0+].

Skrolla ned p√• n√§sta sida tills du ser en knapp som s√§ger "Download APK". Tryck p√• knappen.

Ignorera varningen och ladda ned filen. (apkmirror.com drivs av "Android Police" som √§r en av v√§rldens st√∂rsta bloggar inriktad p√• Android).

N√§r filen har laddats ned s√• f√•r du en notis som s√§ger att den √§r klar. Tryck p√• notisen f√∂r att installera. Se bilder nedan.

Registrera kontot genom att synka ihop med ert nuvarande Instagram-konto. L√§gg till mig sen p√• Threads https://www.threads.net/@alexander.klippel s√• h√∂rs vi :)

items.content_text:
P√• min arbetsplats har vi en aktiv gruppchatt i Microsoft Teams d√§r vi diskuterar kunder och deras problem. Ibland f√•r vi in saker d√§r problemet √§r relaterat till Microsoft drift och deras tj√§nster. S√• f√∂r att f√• in driftst√∂rningar har jag ,ed hj√§lp av Microsoft Power Automate skapat ett fl√∂de som g√∂r just det.

S√• fr√•n Microsoft Twitterkonto

Till detta

F√∂r att implementera detta beh√∂ver du:

  • Microsoft 365-konto
  • Twitter-konto

Inne i Power Automate s√• kopplar du ihpp med ditt Twitter-konto. Du kan anv√§nda ditt personliga Twitter-konto eller skapa ett nytt.

Kom ig√•ng

Surfa in p√• https://powerautomate.microsoft.com och logga in med ditt Microsoft-konto.

Fr√•n menyn tryck p√• Create och sedan Automated Flow.

Ge ditt fl√∂de ett l√§mpligt namn, exempel "Microsoft 365 status till Teams". Sedan under Choose your flow‚Äôs trigger, s√∂k efter tweet. Klicka p√• Create.

Logga in med ditt Twitter-konto.

Tryck p√• Authorize app f√∂r att kunna l√•ta Power Automate l√§sa tweets p√• Twitter.

Efter att du autentiserat Twitter s√• kommer visas nedanst√•ende f√∂nster. I denna skriver du from:@MSFT365Status och tryck sedan p√• Apply.

Klicka p√• New Step.

D√• kontot @MSFT365Status ibland svarar p√• andras tweets eller liknande s√• vill vi filtrera bort dessa. Annars kommer allt att skickas in till Teams. S√• f√∂r att filtrera bort allt som inte √§r tweets (och inte svar) fr√•n ovan konto s√• anv√§nder vi in_reply_to_user_id.

Klicka p√• Choose a value field. S√∂k och klicka sedan p√• in_reply_to_user_id.

Tryck p√• rutan i mitt och v√§lj is not equal to och l√§mna sista rutan tom.

Under if no l√§gger vi till v√•rt meddelande som ska skickas till Teams. Konfigurera hur du vill ha det.

Nu √§r fl√∂det klart och du kan spara det.

N√§sta g√•ng kontot @MSFT365Status tweetar s√• kommer det att skickas in automatiskt till Teams enligt ovan.

items.content_text:
Jag hade tr√•kig en dag och best√§mde mig f√∂r att bygga ihop en egen v√∂rtkylare till mitt osunda intresse f√∂r √∂lbryggning.

Tidigare anv√§nde jag en improviserad variant i duschen, men k√§nde att det inte riktigt lirade fullt ut.

Och resultatet blev s√• h√§r

Allt som allt kostade detta mig ca 600 kr. Allt kan k√∂pas p√• Biltema.

  • PVC, 12 mm, 5 meter (15-316) - 39.90 kr
  • Slangkl√§mmor, √ò 14-16 mm (61-848) - 14.90 kr
  • Nippel, 1/2" (26-714) - 26.90 kr
  • √ñverg√•ngsnippel, M24 x 1 utv√§ndig g√§nga, G1/2" (87-220) - 29.90 kr
  • St√∂dhylsa, 12 x 1.0 mm (87-421) - 59.90 kr
  • Kopparr√∂r, √ò 12 x 1.0 mm, 5 m (87-963) - 449 kr

Beroende p√• koppling p√• kranen kan du beh√∂va k√∂pa olika delar. Du kan hitta olika varianter h√§r.

Allt jag k√∂pte fr√•n Biltema

B√∂rja med att skala all plast fr√•n kopparr√∂ret.
Anv√§nd en kniv du inte √§r s√• r√§dd om, d√• bladet kommer att bli r√§tt sl√∂ efter det h√§r.

N√§r du √§r klar s√• ska det se ut s√• h√§r

Om kopparr√∂ret du k√∂pt √§r kl√§md s√• beh√∂ver du kapa bort √§ndarna.

B√∂j sedan r√∂ret som en spiral. Jag hade inga verktyg f√∂r det h√§r, s√• jag fick improvisera med en kastrull.

D√• kopparr√∂ret √§r mjukt s√• √§r det bra att anv√§nda st√∂dhylsor p√• de st√§llen man kan anv√§nda slangkl√§mma.

Koppla sen ihop med kranen. Nemas problemas!

items.content_text:
Idag, fredag eftermiddag, n√§r jag skriver detta ser min inbox ut s√• h√§r:

N√§r man pr√∂vat p√• konceptet Inbox Zero s√• kommer man aldrig vilja g√• tillbaka till den d√§r r√∂ran d√• man hade alla mejl i inkorgen och ol√§sta p√• sin att-g√∂ra-lista.

Att n√• Inbox Zero med Outlook √§r enkelt och kr√§ver max fem minuter av din tid f√∂r att konfigurera upp.

Den h√§r setupen snodde jag rakt av efter att ha l√§st ett blogginl√§gg. Konceptet kommer dock fr√•n David Allens bok Getting Things Done. Du kan g√∂ra samma sak och sno det h√§r rakt av eller s√§tta upp det precis som du vill ha det. Jag rekommenderar dock att man f√∂ljer grunden och bygger sin metodik ovanp√• denna. F√∂rdelen med denna √§r att det √§r enkelt att s√§tta upp och fungerar i princip p√• alla enheter.

4-D st√•r f√∂r:

Done - Jag √§r klar med det h√§r. Anv√§nd denna n√§r du inte beh√∂ver svara p√• mejlet eller √§r klar med √§rendet.

Do - Jag g√∂r det h√§r p√• direkten. Anv√§nd denna n√§r du kan svara p√• ett mejl eller klara av det p√• n√•gon minut. Skjut inte upp enkla grejer.

Defer - Jag g√∂r det h√§r senare. Anv√§nd n√§r mejlet kr√§ver lite mer insats eller tankekraft innan du svarar. Kanske p√• ett v√§ldigt l√•ngt mejl eller att det kr√§ver liten insats innan du √§r klar.

Delegate - N√•gon annan kan g√∂ra det h√§r. Anv√§nd n√§r du kan l√§gga √∂ver ansvaret p√• n√•gon annan och kunna f√∂lja upp √§rendet.

Konfiguration

Att s√§tta upp det h√§r i Outlook √§r enkelt. B√∂rja med att skapa en mapp som heter Done. Om du √§r en s√•n som sorterar upp alla mejl i olika inkorgar s√• kan du l√•ta det vara. Personligen l√•ter jag alla mejl landa i "Done" till slut och kan sedan s√∂ka fram mejlen. I de fall jag beh√∂ver sortera upp mejlen kategoriserar jag dem ist√§llet med f√§rgkodningar och namn.

F√∂r att f√∂renkla Inbox Zero s√• ska du s√§tta upp lite genv√§gar f√∂r att kunna snabbt sortera dina mejl.

Klicka p√• pilen nere till v√§nster vid genv√§garna och sedan Manage Quick Steps.

Sedan p√• New och Custom.

Konfigurera sedan upp "DONE!" s√• h√§r.

Forts√§tt att s√§tta upp "DO!", "DEFER!" och "DELEGATE!" s√• h√§r.

Anv√§nd sedan genv√§garna uppe i menyn och b√∂rja sortera dina mejl. Forts√§tt tills det √§r tomt.

Bilderna ovan √§r r√§tt sj√§lvf√∂rklarande, men jag skriver lite kort om dem ifall n√•got √§r otydligt.

Nu n√§r du v√§ljer DONE! kommer mejlet att klarmarkeras och flyttas till mappen Done! V√§ljer du DO! kommer den att √∂ppna ett nytt mejl med reply-all, klarmarkera mejlet och flytta till mappen Done!

V√§ljer du Defer! flyttas mejlet till mappen Done!, men skapar samtidigt en task (uppgift) i Outlook som ligger och v√§ntar p√• att du skall agera. Det √§r ocks√• h√§r du ska b√∂rja peta och jobba n√§r du √§r nere p√• noll mejl eller har tid √∂ver.

Du kan √§ven l√§gga upp s√• att du har dina tasks (uppgifter) bredvid din inkorg.

V√§ljer du Delegate!, flyttas √§ven detta mejl till Done! och skapar en task (uppgift). Skillnaden h√§r √§r den √∂ppnar uppgiften innan den sparas. P√• s√• s√§tt kan du fylla i egna anteckningar om vad ska utf√∂ras och vem som tar √∂ver ansvaret att det blir gjort. Den kommer √§ven att √∂ppna nytt mejl d√§r du kan vidarebefordra inneh√•llet.

Det enda jag √§ndrat p√• i systemet ovan √§r att i genv√§gen Defer! s√• flyttar jag mejlen till en mapp som heter DEFER! P√• s√• s√§tt har jag koll p√• vilka mejl som jag beh√∂ver agera p√• ut√∂ver att se dem under tasks. Det m√∂jligg√∂r ocks√• s√• att man kan komma √•t dessa fr√•n mobilen eller andra enheter som inte st√∂djer Outlook Tasks.

K√∂r du Inbox Zero idag?
